raw_text:
U2 stars enter rock Hall of Fame
 
 Singer Bruce Springsteen has inducted Irish rock band U2 into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame, in New York.
 
 The lavish ceremony, celebrating the 50th anniversary of rock 'n' roll, also saw the induction of the Pretenders, Percy Sledge, the O'Jays and Buddy Guy. "This was a band that wanted to lay claim to this world and the next one, too," said Springsteen. Bono, The Edge, Adam Clayton and Larry Mullen Jr, who formed U2 at school in 1977, begin a world tour on 28 March. Introducing the band, Springsteen mocked Bono as the man who "single-handedly pioneered the Irish mullet", poking fun at "one of the best and most endearingly messianic complexes in rock 'n' roll". But he also spoke of the group's enduring stature, adding that it was the only band of the last 20 years where he knew all four members' names.
 
 U2's contemporaries, the Pretenders, led by Chrissie Hynde - took to the stage to perform My City Was Gone with inductee Neil Young. "We are a tribute band," said Hynde, 53. "We're paying tribute to James Honeyman-Scott and Pete Farndon, without whom we would not have been here," she said, referring to the premature deaths of two of the band's guitarists from drug overdoses.
 
 Britain's Rod Stewart introduced Percy Sledge, citing his best-known hit When a Man loves a Woman as "one of the best performances I've ever heard". Justin Timberlake introduced soul group the O'Jays, a gospel-style quartet from Ohio, who performed a medley of their best-known songs including Back Stabbers, Love Train and For the Love of Money. "Anyone who's ever written, produced or performed something soulful stands in the shadows of these giants," said Timberlake.
 
 Joining the ceremony at New York's Waldorf Astoria were legendary R&B star Bo Diddley, who performed with Eric Clapton and Robbie Robertson.
 
 Clapton, alongside BB King, also introduced fellow guitarist Buddy Guy and recalled seeing him play as a teenager in England. "He was for me what Elvis was probably like for other people," he said. "My course was set and he was my pilot," said Clapton who joined Guy and King in a performance of Let Me Love You Baby. Also performing at the ceremony was veteran musician Jerry Lee Lewis who continued his reputation as a rowdy piano-pounder despite his 69 years, kicking over his stool and sitting on the piano during a rendition of Whole Lotta Shakin' Goin' On.
llama3.2:1b: U2 is inducted into Rock and Roll Hall of Fame. The ceremony also includes inductions for Percy Sledge, Buddy Guy, Chrissie Hynde of The Pretenders, and Neil Young. The ceremony marks the 50th anniversary of rock 'n' roll. Other performers include Rod Stewart, Justin Timberlake, Bo Diddley, Eric Clapton with BB King, Jerry Lee Lewis.
llama3.2:3b: U2 was inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame by Bruce Springsteen, joining other inductees including The Pretenders, Percy Sledge, the O'Jays, and Buddy Guy. Springsteen praised U2's enduring stature, noting he knew all four members' names over the past 20 years. The ceremony also included performances by The Pretenders, Percy Sledge, the O'Jays, Eric Clapton, Buddy Guy, and Jerry Lee Lewis, who performed despite being 69 years old.
gemma2:2b:
U2 was inducted into the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame by Bruce Springsteen, alongside The Pretenders, Percy Sledge, the O'Jays, and Buddy Guy.  Springsteen joked about U2's Bono and the band's enduring influence. 
The ceremony celebrated the 50th anniversary of rock 'n' roll, featuring performances by Chrissie Hynde, Rod Stewart, Justin Timberlake, and more. 
Performers included Bo Diddley, Eric Clapton, BB King, and Jerry Lee Lewis.
qwen2.5:0.5b: U2 is inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame for their album My City Was Gone. Other bands, including the Pretenders, were also inducted into the Hall of Fame. The event included performances by Rod Stewart and members of the O’Jays and other musicians from Britain.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Bruce Springsteen inducts Irish rock band U2 into Rock and Roll Hall of Fame; introduces other musicians including Pretenders, Percy Sledge, O'Jays, Buddy Guy, Bo Diddley, Eric Clapton, Robbie Robertson, Justin Timberlake, Rod Stewart, Buddy Guy, Jerry Lee Lewis.
qwen2.5:3b: U2 is inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame by Bruce Springsteen at an event celebrating the 50th anniversary of rock 'n' roll. Other bands inducted include The Pretenders, Percy Sledge, The O'Jays, and Buddy Guy. U2's induction speech includes a playful reference to Bono’s mullet hairstyle. Chrissie Hynde introduces The Pretenders, who mention the deaths of two members from drug overdoses. Justin Timberlake highlights the soulful performances of the O’Jays, acknowledging them as giants in the genre. Bo Diddley performs with Eric Clapton and Robbie Robertson. Clapton recalls his early experience with Buddy Guy, calling him an influential mentor. Jerry Lee Lewis demonstrates his rowdy piano skills during the ceremony.
opencoder:1.5b:
U2 stars enter rock Hall of Fame.
 
Singer Bruce Springsteen has inducted Irish rock band U2 into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame, in New York.

The ceremony at New York's Waldorf Astoria saw the induction of the Pretenders, Percy Sledge, the O'Jays and Buddy Guy. "This was a band that wanted to lay claim to this world and the next one, too," said Springsteen. Bono, The Edge, Adam Clayton and Larry Mullen Jr, who formed U2 at school in 1977, begin a world tour on 28 March.

Introducing the band, Springsteen mocked Bono as the man who "single-handedly pioneered the Irish mullet", poking fun at "one of the best and most endearingly messianic complexes in rock 'n' roll". But he also spoke of the group's enduring stature, adding that it was the only band of the last 20 years where he knew all four members' names.

U2's contemporaries, the Pretenders, led to the stage by Chrissie Hynde - referring to the premature deaths of two of the band's guitarists from drug overdoses.

The Rod Stewart introduced Percy Sledge as a tribute to James Honeyman-Scott and Pete Farndon. "We are a tribute band," said Hynde, 53. "We're paying tribute to James Honeyman-Scott and Pete Farndon, without whom we would not have been here," she said.

John Lee Jones introduced the O'Jays, a gospel-style quartet from Ohio who performed medley of their best-known songs including Back Stabbers, Love Train and For the Love of Money. "Anyone who's ever written, produced or performed something soulful stands in the shadows of these giants," said Lee Jones.

Clapton, alongside BB King, introduced fellow guitarist Buddy Guy and recalled seeing him play as a teenager in England. "He was for me what Elvis was probably like for other people," he said. "My course was set and he was my pilot," said Clapton who joined Guy and King in a performance of Let Me Love You Baby.

Also playing at the ceremony was veteran musician Jerry Lee Lewis, kicking over his stool and sitting on the piano during a rendition of Whole Lotta Shakin' Goin' On. Despite his 69 years, he continued his reputation as a rowdy piano-pounder.
smollm:1.7b: U2 has inducted U2 into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in New York.

The text then goes into more detail about U2's background, saying they were a band that wanted to lay claim to the world and the next one. It also mentions their song My City Was Gone was performed by Neil Young inductee Neil Young.

Next, it talks about other famous people who introduced U2 or their groups. Bono introduced them at school when they formed U2 in 1977. The Pretenders led by Chrissie Hynde gave a performance of "When a Man loves a Woman" as one of the best performances they've ever heard.

Percy Sledge, who is known for his hit "When a Man loves a Woman," was introduced by Britain's Rod Stewart with the band performing that song. Similarly, Justin Timberlake introduced soul group the O'Jays, which performed songs like "Back Stabbers," "Love Train," and "For the Love of Money."

Bo Diddley, known for his R&B career, joined Eric Clapton and Robbie Robertson to perform with them.

Buddy Guy was also in a performance with Clapton and King, playing along with Buddy. Additionally, Jerry Lee Lewis performed on stage during the ceremony and continued his rowdy piano persona despite being 69 years old.

I need to make sure that all these points are included concisely without adding any extra information or explanations. The user specified not to include any reasoning process or explanations, just the summary in plain text.
</think>

Bruce Springsteen has officially introduced the U2 band into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame during a lavish ceremony celebrating their 50th anniversary. Notable introductions include those by Bono (formed at school in 1977), The Pretenders, Rod Stewart with "When a Man loves a Woman," Justin Timberlake with "Back Stabbers, Love Train, and For the Love of Money," Bo Diddley joining Eric Clapton and Robbie Robertson, Buddy Guy performing alongside Clapton, BB King, and others, and Jerry Lee Lewis continuing his rhythmic piano persona.
tinyllama:1.1b: The Rock and Roll Hall of Fame inducted Irish rock band U2 into its ranks, with the induction ceremony taking place in New York City on March 28. The ceremony also saw the induction of the Pretenders, a band that included Chrissie Hynde, who led the stage during performances by the popular British soul group the O'Jays and American rockers U2. Legendary R&B star Bo Didlly also performed at the ceremony alongside fellow musicians Eric Clapton and Robbie Robertson, highlighting how the Irish band's enduring stature is due to its diverse lineup of talented artists. The ceremony was also attended by notable performers including Rod Stewart, Justin Timberlake, and veteran musician Jerry Lee Lewis.
tinydolphin:1.1b: The Rock and Roll Hall of Fame honored Irish rock band U2 with induction into their prestigious institution, marking their entry into this exclusive club for outstanding achievements in rock 'n' roll music. In addition to the U2 inductees, other notable bands were also inducted, including the Pretenders, Percy Sledge, the O'Jays, and Buddy Guy, showcasing the continued influence of rock 'n' roll music on modern popular culture.
phi:2.7b: The article reports that Bruce Springsteen inducted U2 into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in New York, along with other rock icons such as The Pretenders, Percy Sledge, the O'Jays, and Buddy Guy. He also revealed his admiration for Bono's "mullet" hairstyle, while the inductees performed their hits on stage.
orca-mini:3b: The text reports on the induction of U2 into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame, where singer Bruce Springsteen inducted the band and spoke about their enduring stature. He introduced Bono (the man who "single-handedly pioneered the Irish mullet"), The Edge, Adam Clayton, and Larry Mullen Jr. U2 began a world tour on March 28th after the ceremony. Other performers included Chrissie Hynde from the Pretenders, who paid tribute to James Honeyman-Scott and Pete Farndon of the Pretenders, and Justin Timberlake introduced the O'Jays. Rod Stewart introduced Percy Sledge, and BB King and Eric Clapton introduced Buddy Guy. Jerry Lee Lewis also performed at the ceremony.
hermes3:3b: U2 inded into Rock Hall of Fame, joined by Pretenders, Percy Sledge, O'Jays, Buddy Guy. Singer Bruce Springsteen inducted band, Bono joked about Irish mullet while praising U2's enduring status. Other artists at ceremony included Neil Young, Rod Stewart, Justin Timberlake, Bo Diddley (performed with Eric Clapton, Robbie Robertson, BB King), Jerry Lee Lewis.
stablelm-zephyr:3b: U2 inducted into Rock and Roll Hall of Fame; Bruce Springsteen honors the band's enduring stature. Other inductees include the Pretenders, Percy Sledge, the O'Jays, and Buddy Guy. Springsteen introduces U2 members, highlighting Bono's iconic hairstyle. Chrissie Hynde and the Pretenders perform "My City Was Gone" in tribute to two of their guitarists who died prematurely. Rod Stewart praises Percy Sledge, while Justin Timberlake highlights the O'Jays as a gospel-style quartet. Legendary R&B star Bo Diddley, Eric Clapton, and Robbie Robertson perform together; Jerry Lee Lewis also performs during the ceremony.
chatgpt-4o-latest: U2 was inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame by Bruce Springsteen in a ceremony celebrating rock 'n' roll's 50th anniversary. Springsteen praised U2's impact while humorously mocking Bono. Other inductees included the Pretenders, Percy Sledge, the O'Jays, and Buddy Guy. Chrissie Hynde of the Pretenders honored late bandmates, while Rod Stewart introduced Percy Sledge, and Justin Timberlake praised the O'Jays. The event featured performances by Bo Diddley with Eric Clapton and Robbie Robertson, as well as Clapton and BB King introducing Buddy Guy. Jerry Lee Lewis closed the night with a lively performance of Whole Lotta Shakin' Goin' On.
stablelm2:1.6b:
Singer Bruce Springsteen inducted U2 into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame, along with other iconic bands such..
  
The ceremony, celebrating the anniversary of rock'n'roll, also saw inductions for The Pretenders, Percy Sledge, the O'Jays, and Buddy Guy. 

Springsteen mocked Bono's Irish mullet while introducing U2, who he knew personally. The band, formed in school by Edge, Clayton & Mullen Jr., began a world tour after this induction.

U2's fellow contemporaries performing included the Pretenders, led by Chrissie Hynde, and the soul group, the O'Jays, under the introduction of Britain's Rod Stewart.

Legendary musicians like Eric Clapton, BB King, and Buddy Guy also participated in the ceremony. 

The event concluded with performances from legendary performers Jerry Lee Lewis.
granite3.1-dense:2b: Bruce Springsteen inducted U2 into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame at New York's Waldorf Astoria, celebrating their 50th anniversary of rock 'n' roll. The ceremony also recognized other notable acts: the Pretenders paid tribute to James Honeyman-Scott and Pete Farndon; Percy Sledge was introduced by Rod Stewart; the O'Jays were honored by Justin Timberlake; Bo Diddley, Eric Clapton, Robbie Robertson, and Buddy Guy performed together. Springsteen joked about Bono's iconic Irish mullet while praising U2's enduring influence. The Pretenders' Chrissie Hynde acknowledged her band's debt to the late guitarists who inspired them. Percy Sledge and the O'Jays performed, with Timberlake highlighting their soulful contributions. Bo Diddley, Clapton, Robertson, and Guy joined forces for a performance of "Let Me Love You Baby." Jerry Lee Lewis, despite his age, maintained his reputation as an energetic piano player during a rendition of "Whole Lotta Shakin' Goin' On." U2 begins their world tour on March 28.
reference: "This was a band that wanted to lay claim to this world and the next one, too," said Springsteen."My course was set and he was my pilot," said Clapton who joined Guy and King in a performance of Let Me Love You Baby."We are a tribute band," said Hynde, 53."He was for me what Elvis was probably like for other people," he said.Introducing the band, Springsteen mocked Bono as the man who "single-handedly pioneered the Irish mullet", poking fun at "one of the best and most endearingly messianic complexes in rock 'n' roll".The lavish ceremony, celebrating the 50th anniversary of rock 'n' roll, also saw the induction of the Pretenders, Percy Sledge, the O'Jays and Buddy Guy.Singer Bruce Springsteen has inducted Irish rock band U2 into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame, in New York.
